DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Electrocardiography QTc Interval Assessment Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the date on which a procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph was performed and the time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula was observed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Procedure Electrocardiography Corrected QT Interval Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder._A procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph. The electrocardiography results may determine whether the heart is performing normally or suffering from abnormalities, may indicate coronary artery blockages, can be used for detecting calcium, magnesium and other electrolyte disturbances, allow the detection of conduction abnormalities, indicate the physical shape of a patient during stress test and provide information on the physical condition of the heart._The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: A procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph. The electrocardiography results may determine whether the heart is performing normally or suffering from abnormalities, may indicate coronary artery blockages, can be used for detecting calcium, magnesium and other electrolyte disturbances, allow the detection of conduction abnormalities, indicate the physical shape of a patient during stress test and provide information on the physical condition of the heart.:The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that displays the electrical activity of the heart.
The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
